intro: Malapoenna hirta, commonly known as the hairy malapoenna, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and grassland habitats, often in semi-arid regions. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage. The species is also used in traditional medicine for various therapeutic purposes.
